channel.title: Project 16 v6 edit 7: can't get start server.bat to work
channel.description:
hi i am having problems with my start server.bat file i got my project 16 v6 one working fine but edit 7 is harder to do
@echo off title YOUR SERVER NAME HERE (<-- i no what to put here) color 0c
echo ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- echo / \ echo / Now compiling server... \ echo / \ echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
javac -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java (<-- not sure about this)
echo ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- echo / \ echo / Now starting server... \ echo / \ echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./Class; server (<-- not sure about this either) pause
what do i put in?

item.title: Project 16 v6 edit 7: can't get start server.bat to work
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

here is a fix, you need to change this with your javac line:

"C:/program files/java/jdk1.5.0_09/bin/javac.exe" -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java

it should work now…

Read full topic

item.title: Project 16 v6 edit 7: can't get start server.bat to work
item.dc:creator: @Uniqaz Uniqaz
item.description:
@Uniqaz wrote:

Yours:
@echo off
title YOUR SERVER NAME HERE
color 0c

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now compiling server…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

javac -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now starting server…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

java -Xmx512m -cp .;./Class; server
pause

Mines:
@echo off
title YOUR SERVER NAME HERE
color 0c

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now compiling server…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac”

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now starting server…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

java -Xmx512m -cp .;./Class; server
pause

Read full topic
item.source: Project 16 v6 edit 7: can't get start server.bat to work

item.title: Project 16 v6 edit 7: can't get start server.bat to work
item.dc:creator: @propabad propabad
item.description:
@propabad wrote:

when i right click and edit this comes up

@echo off
title YOUR SERVER NAME HERE
color 0c

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now compiling server…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

javac -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now starting server…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

java -Xmx512m -cp .;./Class; server
pause

which bits do i edit? (besides YOUR SERVER NAME HERE)[br][size=1]Posted at: November 27, 2006, 09:25:29 AM[/size][hr]ok i changed it 2 “C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_09injavac” and all this came up

/
/ Now compiling server…
/

Usage: javac
where possible options include:
-g Generate all debugging info
-g:none Generate no debugging info
-g:{lines,vars,source} Generate only some debugging info
-nowarn Generate no warnings
-verbose Output messages about what the compiler is doing
-deprecation Output source locations where deprecated APIs are u
sed
-classpath Specify where to find user class files
-cp Specify where to find user class files
-sourcepath Specify where to find input source files
-bootclasspath Override location of bootstrap class files
-extdirs Override location of installed extensions
-endorseddirs Override location of endorsed standards path
-d Specify where to place generated class files
-encoding Specify character encoding used by source files
-source Provide source compatibility with specified release

-target Generate class files for specific VM version
-version Version information
-help Print a synopsis of standard options
-X Print a synopsis of nonstandard options
-J Pass directly to the runtime system

/
/ Now starting server…
/

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

hmm not sure about it but
instead of

javac -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java

use

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac"
